การจดทะเบียน Coinbase ไม่สามารถผลักดัน HYPE ได้เนื่องจากโครงสร้างตลาดจำกัดการเพิ่มขึ้น

Coinbase listing fails to lift HYPE as market structure caps upside

1d ago//Adewale Olarinde
general
AI

Summary

TH

แม้ว่า Coinbase จะประกาศเปิดซื้อขายแบบ spot สำหรับคู่ HYPE-USD แต่ราคา HYPE กลับดิ่งลงกว่า 7% ซึ่งสะท้อนว่าแรงกดดันจากโครงสร้างตลาดยังครอบงำข่าวดีต่างๆ โทเค็นได้ร่วงลงไปแล้ว 40% จากระดับสูงสุดในเดือนตุลาคม โดยกราฟราคายังคงแสดงรูปแบบลดลงต่อเนื่องและถูกต้านทานที่บริเวณแนวต้าน $35-$38 สถานการณ์นี้บ่งชี้ว่าผู้ขายกำลังปกป้องระดับสำคัญอย่างแข็งขัน ทำให้ไม่สามารถเกิดแรงขับเคลื่อนขาขึ้นที่ยั่งยืนได้ในขณะนี้ ปฏิกิริยาที่อ่อนแอของตลาดสะท้อนให้เห็นถึงความรู้สึกเชิงลบทั่วไปในตลาด altcoins ซึ่งการถอนเงินลงทุน (leverage unwinds) ทำให้นักเทรดมักใช้โอกาสราคาดีขึ้นเพื่อขายทำกำไร (sell into strength) มากกว่าการเข้าสะสม

EN

Despite the confirmation of a spot listing on Coinbase for the HYPE-USD pair, Hyperliquid’s native token HYPE declined by over 7%, showing that bearish market structures are currently outweighing positive news. The token has fallen 40% from its October peak, with technical indicators revealing a persistent pattern of lower highs and resistance near the $35-$38 supply zone. This suggests that sellers are aggressively defending key levels, preventing any sustained upside momentum even with improved exchange access. The muted reaction reflects a fragile sentiment across the altcoin market, where leverage unwinds are causing traders to sell into strength rather than accumulate positions.

Key Points

  • HYPE dropped over 7% despite the Coinbase spot listing announcement.
  • The token remains in a downtrend, rejected at the $35-$38 supply zone with bearish technical structure.
  • Fragile altcoin sentiment and leverage unwinds are driving traders to sell into rallies rather than buy.

Article

Journalist Posted: February 6, 2026 Hyperliquid’s native token, HYPE, remained under pressure on Thursday despite a confirmed spot listing announcement from Coinbase. The trend underscores how broader market conditions and bearish price structure continue to outweigh positive catalysts across altcoins. Coinbase Markets said spot trading for HYPE would go live on 5 February , with the HYPE-USD pair opening later in the day, subject to liquidity conditions. Listings on major U.S. exchanges are typically viewed as demand catalysts, expanding access for spot buyers and institutional participants. In HYPE’s case, however, price action told a different story. Source: X At the time of writing, HYPE was trading near $32.9 , down more than 7% on the day , extending a broader downtrend that has been in place since October. The token has now shed over 40% from its peak near $58–60 , with successive rallies failing to reclaim prior resistance levels. Bearish structure overrides positive HYPE news The daily chart shows a clear pattern of lower highs and lower lows, with the most recent rebound stalling below the $35–38 supply zone. That area previously served as support before breaking down in December, and sellers have consistently defended it since then. Source: TradingView While the Coinbase announcement coincided with a brief intraday bounce, follow-through was limited. Price was rejected once again below resistance, reinforcing the view that HYPE remains structurally weak despite improving fundamentals. Trading volume picked up modestly during the session but failed to match the intensity seen during earlier capitulation moves. This suggests repositioning rather than aggressive spot accumulation, a sign that market participants remain cautious rather than willing to chase upside. Altcoin sentiment remains fragile HYPE’s muted reaction also reflects a broader altcoin environment defined by leverage unwinds and risk aversion. Recent liquidation data shows that long positions across major altcoins have absorbed the bulk of forced closures amid heightened volatility, as traders reduce exposure. In this context, positive developments such as exchange listings have struggled to generate sustained momentum unless accompanied by a decisive break in market structure. For HYPE, that would likely require reclaiming the $38–40 region, which remains well above current levels. Until then, the market is treating rallies as opportunities to sell into strength rather than signals of trend reversal. Final Thoughts HYPE’s Coinbase spot listing failed to invalidate its broader downtrend, with price once again rejected below key resistance. The reaction highlights how fragile altcoin sentiment remains, as structure and positioning continue to outweigh positive headlines.
